Prerequisites: COMPLETION OF BUSINESS ADMINISTRATION IN ACCOUNTING AND LOWER-LEVEL COURSES.
Course Description: THIS COURSE EXAMINES THE INTERRELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN INFORMATION SYSTEMS AND ACCOUNTING TO PREPARE STUDENTS TO BE KNOWLEDGEABLE BUSINESS ADVISORS. THE COURSE PROVIDES AN OVERVIEW ON HOW TO STORE, RETRIEVE, ANALYZE, AND CONTROL DATA USING INFORMATION SYSTEMS. IT ALSO EXPOSES THE STUDENT TO SPECIFIC SOFTWARE PACKAGES SUCH AS MICROSOFT EXCEL, ACCESS, VISIO, GREAT PLAINS OR PEACHTREE.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1. ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS AND BUSINESS PROCESSES.
2. SYSTEMS DEVELOPMENT, DOCUMENTATION, AND SYSTEMS ANALYSIS.
3. EXCEL TUTORIALS.
4. RELATION DATABASES.
5. ACCESS TUTORIAL; COMPUTER FRAUD AND ABUSE.
6. INFORMATION SYSTEMS CONTROLS.
7. AUDITING BASED INFORMATION SYSTEMS.
1. QUERY DATABASES FOR PROVIDE INSIGHTS ABOUT OPERATIONS AND PERFORMANCE.
2. DESIGN BUSINESS PROCESSES AND REPRESENT THEM WITH DOCUMENTATION TOOLS.
3. DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT WELL-STRUCTURED DATABASES TO ENABLE BUSINESS PROCESSES.
4. EVALUATE INTERNAL CONTROL IN INFORMATION SYSTEMS AND DESIGN CONTROLS TO MITIGATE RISKS.
Textbook(s):
ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEMS (LATEST EDITION)
ROMMEY AND STEINBART/PEARSON

COMPUTERIZED ACCOUNTING USING PEACHTREE (LATEST EDITION)
            SAGE COMPLETE ACCOUNTING/MCGRAW-HILL
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
